Upgrading to pins 1.0.0

Source: vignettes/pins-legacy.Rmd
pins-legacy.Rmd

pins 1.0.0 introduced a completely new API designed to be more explicit and less magical. While the legacy API will continue to be supported for some time, it will not gain any new features, so it’s good to plan to switch to the new interface.

This vignette shows a couple of examples converting legacy code to the modern API, then shows the equivalences between the legacy and modern function names.

library(pins)

Examples

A simple example of the legacy API looks something like this:

board_register_local("vignette", tempfile())

pin(head(mtcars), "mtcars", board = "vignette")
pin_get("mtcars", board = "vignette")
#>                    mpg cyl disp  hp drat    wt  qsec vs am gear carb
#> Mazda RX4         21.0   6  160 110 3.90 2.620 16.46  0  1    4    4
#> Mazda RX4 Wag     21.0   6  160 110 3.90 2.875 17.02  0  1    4    4
#> Datsun 710        22.8   4  108  93 3.85 2.320 18.61  1  1    4    1
#> Hornet 4 Drive    21.4   6  258 110 3.08 3.215 19.44  1  0    3    1
#> Hornet Sportabout 18.7   8  360 175 3.15 3.440 17.02  0  0    3    2
#> Valiant           18.1   6  225 105 2.76 3.460 20.22  1  0    3    1

There are three major changes:

  • You create an explicit board object which you use instead of the name.
  • You use pin_read() and pin_write() instead of pin_get() and pin().
  • The board object is the always the first argument.

So the code above translates to:

board <- board_local()

board %>% pin_write(head(mtcars), "mtcars")
#> Guessing `type = 'rds'`
#> Creating new version '20210824T184925Z-3e025'
board %>% pin_read("mtcars")
#>                    mpg cyl disp  hp drat    wt  qsec vs am gear carb
#> Mazda RX4         21.0   6  160 110 3.90 2.620 16.46  0  1    4    4
#> Mazda RX4 Wag     21.0   6  160 110 3.90 2.875 17.02  0  1    4    4
#> Datsun 710        22.8   4  108  93 3.85 2.320 18.61  1  1    4    1
#> Hornet 4 Drive    21.4   6  258 110 3.08 3.215 19.44  1  0    3    1
#> Hornet Sportabout 18.7   8  360 175 3.15 3.440 17.02  0  0    3    2
#> Valiant           18.1   6  225 105 2.76 3.460 20.22  1  0    3    1

Pinning files

Another way to use pin() is with a path to a file:

path <- tempfile()
writeLines(letters, path)

pin(path, "alphabet", board = "vignette")
pin_get("alphabet", board = "vignette")
#> [1] "/tmp/RtmpInA7oK/file2952705e2326/alphabet/file2952630e3e9c"

pins 1.0.0 clearly separates the two cases of pin an object and pinning a file, so instead of pin_write() and pin_read() you need to pin_upload() and pin_download():

board %>% pin_upload(path, "alphabet")
#> Creating new version '20210824T184925Z-ee580'
board %>% pin_download("alphabet")
#> [1] "~/.local/share/pins/alphabet/20210824T184925Z-ee580/file2952630e3e9c"

Pinning a url

Finally, you can pin() a url to automatically re-download it when it changes:

base <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rstudio/pins/master/tests/testthat/"

(pin(paste0(base, "pin-files/first.txt"), board = "vignette"))
#> [1] "/tmp/RtmpInA7oK/file2952705e2326/first/first.txt"

(It’s a little confusing that this uses pin() rather than pin_get().)

This now needs to be made explicit with the new board_url(), and since this returns a path, not a file, you need to use pin_download():

board_github <- board_url(c(
  raw = paste0(base, "pin-files/first.txt")
))
board_github %>% pin_download("raw")
#> [1] "~/.cache/pins/url/87473d3442e598f929b65b6630da6fd8/first.txt"

Implicit board

It’s also possible to use pin() and pin_get() without an explicit board argument, in which case it automatically uses a local board:

pin(data.frame(x = 1:3), "test-data")
pin_get("test-data")
#>   x
#> 1 1
#> 2 2
#> 3 3

To convert this, you just need to create an explicit board:

board <- board_local()

board %>% pin_write(data.frame(x = 1:3), "test-data")
#> Guessing `type = 'rds'`
#> Creating new version '20210824T184925Z-73dc1'
board %>% pin_read("test-data")
#>   x
#> 1 1
#> 2 2
#> 3 3

Equivalents

Board functions

Legacy API Modern API
board_register_azure() board_azure()
board_register_datatxt()
board_register_dospace()
board_register_gcloud()
board_register_github()
board_register_local() board_local()
board_register_kaggle()
board_register_rsconnect() board_rsconnect()
board_register_s3() board_s3()
pin() with a URL board_url()
board_folder()

Future releases will add support for additional boards based on user feedback.

Pin functions

Legacy API Modern API
board_browse() pin_browse()
pin() pin_write() / pin_upload()
pin_get() pin_read() / pin_upload()
pin_find() pin_search()
pin_info() pin_meta()
pin_reactive() pin_reactive_read() / pin_reactive_download()
pin_remove() pin_delete()
